newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 9.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 9.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Wednesday morning.
** The Delhi High Court is likely to rule on former Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao's application against a non-bailable arrest warrant issued against him
** Vote counting starts in populous Uttar Pradesh state after local elections
** India's rating as attractive emerging stock market under threat following slowing economy, political uncertainties and depressed stocks
** The Communist Party of India (Marxist), a partner in the 13-party minority ruling coalition, warns the government on its liberal foreign direct investment policy, the Economic Times reports
** The Finance Ministry has directed market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India to evolve stringent norms for regulating short-selling, the Business Standard reports
** The spot dollar/rupee opened steady at 35.62/63 per dollar, dealers said
** On Monday, share prices across India bounced back from an early plunge thanks to domestic institutions and selective short covering but the undercurrent was shaky, brokers said
** The 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index closed 24.49 points, or 0.82 percent, higher at 3,027.35 after sliding to 2,930.93 in early trade
** The 100-share National index gained 4.99 points, or 0.37 percent, to 1,350.39
** The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index eased 0.10 points to 873.90
** The 500-share CRISIL index gained 1.58 points, or 0.27 percent, to 583.84
** The Delhi share index rose 3.38 points to 683.20
** The Calcutta index shed 0.05 points to 415.10
** The Madras index fell 133.72 points to 3,147.74
** The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR Index lost 0.11 points to 58.59 with the premium over the local market at 9.35 percent
